screen_desc: The screenshot shows the "Search for apps & games" screen on a mobile device, likely from the Google Play Store. It displays a list of recent searches, including apps like Google Drive, Roku Remote, Truecaller, and Airtel Thanks app. Each app has a small icon and a link, possibly for installing or opening the app. The search functionality allows users to find apps quickly based on their previous searches.
history_actions: click on the "Play Store" icon located at the right and lower part of the screen.
click on the magnifying glass search icon located at the top-right corner.

think_action.Thought: The current screen displays the search bar in the Google Play Store, but the app the user wants to uninstall, 'Lyft - Rideshare, Bikes, Scooters & Transit', is not shown in the recent searches. The next step will involve searching for 'Lyft' to locate the app in the Play Store.
Future Action Plan: Search for 'Lyft' in the search bar.
Locate the 'Lyft' app from the search results.
Click on the 'Lyft' app to open its page.
Tap the 'Uninstall' button to remove the app.
think_action.Next Single Step Action: Type 'Lyft' in the search bar and search.
